snippet.textDisplay: I just started playing this for the first time since it came in game pass, and I got a say .. this is probably my second favorite souls game. The way they've implemented the umbral zone UNDER the main game. It's so flawless and natural. Like.. the fact that it can be done anywhere at any time is awesome to me. Unlike other games that use this mechanic it's the FULL game.. others would make like only area specific zones for it, and then it becomes just a cheap obstacle puzzle. In LOTF it genuinely feels like.. idk how to do explain it.. it's just awesome. It feels like the upside down in stranger things. And don't even get me started on the mechanics of it... Like the fact that if you're using your lamp in the real world, there is an entire world of enemies on the other side of the veil... Them being able to pull you into the other side just looking into their world, makes it feel... Alive.. so awesome...

snippet.textDisplay: If you're going to fight a red reaper, the best time to do it is before a boss fight. You will get a ton of vigor since its 3x. Also there are runes and rings that increase vigor gains. I currently am running two vigor runes and two vigor rings aka moth rings which has my multiplier at x 1.40 once you go into umbral it will be at 1.50. You will need to unlock new game plus to achieve this. Also hammers are effective against red reapers. That is what i use every time. With the set up i have i can easily get to 150,000 vigor or more in less than an hour. And 1 more thing. The leposarium is one of the best farming areas aince there are so many heavy enemies and when you go into new game plus there are game modifications that you can enable. I used increased enemy density and pre upgraded loot which helps alot since some weapobs dont come pre upgraded like pieta sword.

snippet.textDisplay: A better way for the Vigor Farm there- where you get more stuff, AND gives ~2000 in about 1m 30 seconds. Siphon & kill spikehead, bursting the pustules, run out on the ledge and kick the witch off, go into umbral which blows up a nearby pustule, then run back, kill the 2 groups by the cave pond, (sometimes you can kill each group all in one whack when dual wielding) then if the guy at the bottom of the pond is standing by the red pustule, siphon it for a kill, then run further outside the back, kill the 3 ghouls, 2 witches, siphon the pustule, then repeat. 1:30 isnt bad for 2K vigor and a LOT of dropped items.

snippet.textDisplay:
I've soloed the red reapers in the depths near the elevator just above the lamp visage. All you need is sanctify and mana regen. This also works well against bosses. And fighting against poisons, burns, and hordes of enemies 

Also the best place to farm for me is in lower calrath where you can farm the big axe guy and the big face guy (in umbral), you get about 1k vigor per run especially with moth ring. But the real treat here are the item drops from the big face guy, I maxed out vestige seeds and moths plus other very useful items here. A lot of runes and large derilium ores as well

snippet.textDisplay:
Here's a Vigor farming tip/cheese (depends how you look at it):
If you have a friend that is playing this game you can get them to beckon you to their world every time they're going to fight a boss, that way you can get the boss Vigor x2 since you're killing the boss in their game and the same one in yours. 
You can also help out randoms, but the lag is crazy in this game on its own so if that person has poor internet connection you will struggle.

snippet.textDisplay:
(Im not sure if this was only My Problem or it is a Bug on The Game)

After You fight The Mistress of Hounds make sure You have at least ONE Vestige Seed (AKA The Thing You use to make Temporary Checkpoints)

After The Fight You Will reach a Place called "Forsaken Fen" (AGAIN make sure You Have Vestige seeds) 

Go on. At some point You Will face a Boss named "Congregator of Flesh" 

After You defeated it. In The Arena Will appear a Stigma (Don't leave it behind) and a Place to create a Vestige (DONT CREATE A VESTIGE HERE). 

Exit The Boss Arena. You Will find another Place to create a Vestige. Create one and rest there. Go ahead and soon after You Will find a Vestige. Rest there. Thats All.


What is The point of all of this?


After i killed The Congregator. I left The place. Then I decided to comeback to make it sure i wasnt forgetting something.
Then I found myself trapped in The Arena. The Exit was Sealed. 

I was able to leave The place because i entered Umbra and let an Enemy kill me.

I continue The Journey because i left a Vestige outside of The Arena. I'm not Sure about it. But I think i was able to continue with the Game thanks to The Vestige i created right after The Fight

snippet.textDisplay: One extra tip. get an enemy low, soulflay them and hit their soul until their remaining health is withered, then use the finisher. When all remaining health is withered, you use a special finisher that grants a rune. So on Spiky head, not only you can farm him for 500 vigor, you can also farm his runes for extra vigor. There are a couple other spots where you can drop a soul seed and farm an enemy, like a Ruiner near lower Calrath, the Infernal Enchantress at Upper Calrath, a Holy Bulwark at the Leprosarium, and so on.

snippet.textDisplay: Also, that "beginner's" farm: you're actually killing that Ardent Penitant the slow way.  If you just sprint past him straight out to the ledge, then make a hard right-angle turn _right at_ the edge, that dumb bastard will dive right off the edge 100% of the time.  Easy-peasy.
snippet.textOriginal: Also, that "beginner's" farm: you're actually killing that Ardent Penitant the slow way.  If you just sprint past him straight out to the ledge, then make a hard right-angle turn _right at_ the edge, that dumb bastard will dive right off the edge 100% of the time.  Easy-peasy.

snippet.textDisplay: Don't just leave Mimic items alone.  All you have to do is soul flay that baby and the Mimic will die instantly.  Here's the thing, though: they don't despawn, and they can drop some really good runes once you have that feature unlocked, so I would suggest leaving them alone until you have the ability to use runes, then just soul flay the Mimic item right from Axiom and then badda-bing, badda-boom, Bob's your uncle.
snippet.textOriginal: Don't just leave Mimic items alone.  All you have to do is soul flay that baby and the Mimic will die instantly.  Here's the thing, though: they don't despawn, and they can drop some really good runes once you have that feature unlocked, so I would suggest leaving them alone until you have the ability to use runes, then just soul flay the Mimic item right from Axiom and then badda-bing, badda-boom, Bob's your uncle.

snippet.textDisplay:
You can soulflay the mendacious Visage enemies (those big walking stone faces you encounter in Umbral) to force their face to open, enabling you to deal increased damage from every angle.
Also: Soulflaying while the face is already open breaks their posture immediately, so you can follow up with a grievious strike.

snippet.textDisplay: Not much of a tip rather than a build/gameplay: there's a umbral eye that when in primary socket, will make you take damage as wither when doing charged attacks. So if you time it right, you charge a heavy attack, get hit and regain your withered health instantly when connecting the attack. This is an awesome survivability gameplay and can fit numerous builds and weapons. And the bigger the weapon, the better, bc the wither window is wider and you hit harder so regain more health (health regained is proportionate to the damage dealt)

snippet.textDisplay:
There's a better spot at the boss pit near the lookout vestige when you go into umbral. You can easily kill the red spectre via a simple exploit (I won't tell how, but know that it's easy). At early levels this spectre drops anywhere from 10-15k vigor per kill. On top of that, you get a 3x multiplier on vigor for all the other umbral ads that spawn. Also the red spectre drops 5 umbral points for remembrances.

This spot does require 1 vestige seed to farm, but is totally worth it, as the moth umbral enemies  can drop vestige seeds :) ! At later levels, you can probably get 50k vigor every 30-ish minutes (this is because the red spectre stops dropping as many souls the higher of a level you get).

This trick/exploit will probably be patched though, as I think it's just this one vestige spot where the trick/exploit exists xD.

snippet.textDisplay:
Dual wielding with heavy weapons isnt worth it... You get the same super slow moveset for dual wielding these weapon types: polearms, greatswords, grand swords, grand axes and grand hammers. The DPS will be actually lower & you consume much more stamina compared to just using one weapon. Its surely bugged but especially a charged R2 attack will only deal the damage of a one handed attack with ONE of the weapons you dual wield. Doesnt makesense to me and has to be fixed. If you charge R2 one weapon while two-handing, it uses less stamina, moveset is faster and it does more damage per hit, like wtf?

tldr: dual wielding only makes sence for regular (small) hammers, axes, swords and daggers

snippet.textDisplay:
So for the red ghosts if you're wanting to farm them, find a gap you have to jump across, wait for the ghost to appear, jump across the gap making sure the ghost stays on the side you were originally on then pull the ghost into the gap using soulflay and It'll fall to its death for easy 7k ish vigor,

You can also now just kill random enemies with the 3x xp until the ghost respawns then rince and repeat.

You can also now just kill random enemies with the 3x xp until the ghost respawns then rince and repeat.

snippet.textDisplay:
SOULS FANS DEFY ALL LOGIC AND COMMON SENSE!
For the life of me, I cannot figure out what THE HELL the appeal is to difficulty so damn high that each boss takes hours, or DAYS to defeat. And sometimes normal enemies too. Seeing the same fight over and over ad infinitum AD NAUSEAUM!

How is this 'FUN'??? I see ZERO fun in repeating each enemy encounter for hours on end. Seeing dying screens endlessly. This is frustrating, this makes me angry, this fills me with rage. Anger, rage and frustration are NEGATIVE emotions...the OPPOSITE of fun! Not once in my life have I ever felt HAPPY, or that I was HAVING FUN...when I was full of RAGE, or FRUSTRATED. 

Souls fans need to donate their brains to science for further study. Because they defy all logic!

For number 17 don‚Äôt fight him. Just sprint past then pull a 90 degree turn at the ledge. Hell fall to his death and his vigor will show up on the platform. About 9/10 times he will do the head down sprint thing chasing you and just go weeeee down. 

Takes about 10 seconds to run to the ledge then return and rest. Much quicker than fighting him.
